intro: Veronica leucantha, commonly known as the white speedwell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Veronica leucantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
